revised_title: Particle Retention in Large Airways of the Respiratory Tract
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the retention of particles in the large airways of the respiratory tract. They discovered that only about 80% of particles were rapidly removed, while 20% were cleared with a mean half-time of 16 hours. Approximately 1% of particles remained in the tracheal tissue for at least 30 days. This retention could be a basis for effects of inhaled toxic particles on the large airways.
